questions_1.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the oil system?
Options: Oil storage
Oil replenishment system
Oil distribution system
Fuel Filter
questions_1.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_1.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "Fuel Filter "

questions_2.question: What is the capacity of the oil tank?
Options: 6.8 quarts
8.8 quarts
10.8 quarts
12.8 quarts
questions_2.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_2.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "6.8 quarts"

questions_3.question: The oil replenishment tank and oil level control panel are components of what system?
Options: IDG oil system
Carbon seal lubrication
Engine oil replenishment
Fan blade lubrication
questions_3.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_3.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "Engine oil replenishment"

questions_4.question: The remote oil replenishment system:
Options: Is mounted and operated from a location in the aft equipment bay of the aircraft.
Is a stand alone cart system brought to the aircraft
Is a hand pump connected to the oil tank
Only required at out-stations
questions_4.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_4.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "Is mounted and operated from a location in the aft equipment bay of the aircraft."

questions_5.question: Which of the following is FALSE for the Oil Pressure sub-system?
Options: The pressure sub-system distributes the oil, under pressure to the required engine components.
The oil is first drawn from the oil tank by a signal pressure element in the lube and scavenge pump and internally ported to the oil filter which is threaded into the pump housing.
In the event of a clogged filter, resulting in high delta pressure across the filter, a bypass valve will open allowing the oil around the filter permitting unfiltered oil into the system.
The high pressure circuit supplies oil to the A sump and the low pressure circuit supplies oil to B and C sump.
questions_5.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_5.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "The high pressure circuit supplies oil to the A sump and the low pressure circuit supplies oil to B and C sump."

questions_6.question: In the Oil Scavenge sub-system, the majority of scavenge oil from the A sump is returned to the pump:
Options: Directly from all scavenge lines
Seperate forward and aft scavenge oil flow lines to the pump
Gravity drains around the radial drive shaft into the AGB
Not returned, A sump is a wet sump system
questions_6.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_6.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "Gravity drains around the radial drive shaft into the AGB"

questions_7.question: The engine oil tank is
Options: at the 10 o'clock position on the upper left side of the engine.
at the 12 o'clock position on the upper right side of the engine.
at the 9 o'clock position on the lower left side of the engine.
at the 2 o'clock position on the lower right side of the engine.
questions_7.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_7.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "at the 10 o'clock position on the upper left side of the engine."

questions_8.question: The electrical chip detector monitors the scavenge oil entering the oil tank for
Options: sulphur content.
metallic particles.
dust particles.
leaking oil.
questions_8.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_8.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "metallic particles."

questions_9.question: When magnetic particles collect across the master chip detector magnet (which may be an early warning of impending part failure), the gap between chip detector electrodes is bridged and:
Options: a red warning message appears on the cockpit EICAS display
the engine goes to idle to protect against part failure
a yellow caution message appears on the cockpit EICAS display
an indication is tripped in the aft equipment bay
questions_9.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_9.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "d. an indication is tripped in the aft equipment bay"

questions_10.question: The main lube and scavenge pump is located
Options: on the aft face of the accessory gearbox at the 7 o'clock position.
on the aft face of the accessory gearbox at the 1 o'clock position.
on the forward face of the accessory gearbox at the 7 o'clock position.
on the forward face of the accessory gearbox at the 1 o'clock position.
questions_10.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_10.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "on the aft face of the accessory gearbox at the 7 o'clock position."

questions_11.question: The main lube and scavenge pump has
Options: 2 positive displacement gerotor elements
10 positive displacement gerotor elements
7 positive displacement gerotor elements
15 positive displacement gerotor elements
questions_11.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_11.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "7 positive displacement gerotor elements"

questions_12.question: Which of the following is FALSE for the Main Lube and Scavange Pump?
Options: Continued contamination will open the bypass around the filter and no indication is given.
The pump draws oil from the supply tank through the one supply element and internally flows across the oil filter internally.
If the delta pressure becomes high enough, due to contamination, the impending bypass switch will close and give an indication to the ground crew.
The pump is geared to the MCD.
questions_12.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_12.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "The pump is geared to the MCD."

questions_13.question: The fuel/oil heat exchanger is mounted on brackets outboard of the combustion chamber frame at the
Options: 7 o'clock position.
2 o'clock position.
10 o'clock position.
12 o'clock position.
questions_13.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_13.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "7 o'clock position."

questions_14.question: The fuel/oil heat exchanger is mounted on brackets outboard of the combustion chamber frame at the
Options: decreases engine oil temperature and increases engine fuel temperature.
increases engine oil temperature and decreases engine fuel temperature.
decreases engine oil and fuel temperature with fan bypass air.
increases engine oil and fuel temperature with compressor bleed air.
questions_14.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_14.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "decreases engine oil temperature and increases engine fuel temperature."

questions_15.question: The oil pressure switch senses the differential pressure between the oil filter downstream pressure and the
Options: fuel/oil heat exchanger inlet pressure.
A-sump aft scavenge pressure.
B-sump aft scavenge pressure.
fuel/oil heat exchanger outlet pressure.
questions_15.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_15.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "B-sump aft scavenge pressure."

questions_16.question: The oil tank pressurization valve is
Options: at the bottom of the oil tank.
at the top of the oil tank.
at the left of the oil tank.
at the right of the oil tank.
questions_16.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_16.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "at the top of the oil tank."

questions_17.question: The oil filter impending bypass sensor
Options: senses the differential pressure across the filter element.
senses the differential pressure across the heat exchanger.
senses the presence of metallic particles in the oil tank.
senses the presence of dust particles in the oil tank.
questions_17.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_17.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "senses the differential pressure across the filter element."

questions_18.question: The oil filter
Options: removes contaminants from the oil.
removes the oxidants from the oil.
detects the metal particles in the oil.
detects the oil pressure of the oil.
questions_18.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_18.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "removes contaminants from the oil."

questions_19.question: To eliminate erroneous oil filter impending bypass indications caused by cold oil temperatures:
Options: all oil will bypass the filter impending bypass sensor during a start condition
a thermal lockout feature is built into the filter impending bypass sensor
the impending bypass indicator trips but resets itself when engine power level exceeds ground idle
the impending bypass indicator trips but resets itself when oil temperature reaches 130Â°F
questions_19.correctFeedback:
That's Correct!

You have chosen the correct option.
questions_19.InCorrectFeedback:
That's Incorrect!

You have chosen the wrong option. The valid answer is "a thermal lockout feature is built into the filter impending bypass sensor"
